statements: SELECT * FROM power_outages;
SELECT outage_location, outage_start_time FROM power_outages WHERE outage_type = 'Equipment Failure';
SELECT outage_id, outage_location, outage_duration FROM power_outages WHERE outage_start_time > '2022-01-01';
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_outages FROM power_outages WHERE affected_customers > 1000;
SELECT outage_type, AVG(affected_customers) AS avg_customers FROM power_outages GROUP BY outage_type ORDER BY avg_customers DESC;
SELECT outage_id, outage_type, outage_location FROM power_outages WHERE outage_start_time > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY outage_start_time DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM power_outages WHERE outage_duration > INTERVAL '2 hours' AND outage_location LIKE '%city%'
SELECT AVG(affected_customers) AS avg_customers FROM power_outages WHERE outage_type = 'Planned'
SELECT outage_type, COUNT(outage_id) AS num_outages FROM power_outages GROUP BY outage_type ORDER BY num_outages DESC
SELECT * FROM power_outages ORDER BY outage_duration ASC, affected_customers DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM power_outages
SELECT location, start_time FROM power_outages WHERE cause = 'weather'
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM grid_disturbances WHERE severity > 3
SELECT location, type, severity FROM grid_disturbances ORDER BY severity DESC
SELECT * FROM power_outages WHERE start_time < '2022-01-01'
SELECT * FROM power_outages WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT outage_id, cause FROM power_outages WHERE cause = 'Weather';
SELECT location, start_time FROM power_outages WHERE start_time > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM power_outages ORDER BY start_time DESC;
SELECT location, type, severity FROM grid_disturbances WHERE severity > 5;
SELECT * FROM PowerOutages;
SELECT outage_time, location FROM PowerOutages WHERE status='resolved';
SELECT * FROM RestorationEfforts WHERE status='in progress';
SELECT location, type FROM GridDisturbances WHERE severity='high' ORDER BY disturbance_time DESC;
SELECT outage_id, COUNT(restoration_id) AS total_restorations FROM RestorationEfforts GROUP BY outage_id HAVING total_restorations > 1;
SELECT * FROM PowerOutages WHERE status = 'resolved';
SELECT location, outage_time FROM PowerOutages WHERE location LIKE '%New York%' ORDER BY outage_time DESC;
SELECT p.outage_id, disturbance_time, location, severity, status FROM PowerOutages p INNER JOIN GridDisturbances g ON p.location = g.location WHERE g.severity = 'high' ORDER BY disturbance_time ASC;
SELECT DISTINCT location FROM PowerOutages UNION SELECT location FROM GridDisturbances;
SELECT outage_id, outage_time, location FROM PowerOutages WHERE status = 'ongoing' OR status = 'scheduled' ORDER BY outage_time DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM PowerOutages;
SELECT outage_id, start_time, end_time FROM PowerOutages ORDER BY start_time DESC;
SELECT team_id, team_name, contact_number FROM ResponseTeams WHERE team_id = 2;
SELECT location, severity FROM GridDisturbances WHERE severity = 'High';
SELECT log_id, outage_id, team_id, action_taken FROM RestorationLog WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM PowerOutages;
SELECT outage_id, start_time, duration FROM PowerOutages WHERE duration > INTERVAL '1 day';
SELECT R.team_name, RL.action_taken, RL.timestamp FROM ResponseTeams R JOIN RestorationLog RL ON R.team_id = RL.team_id;
SELECT GD.location, GD.severity, count(*) FROM GridDisturbances GD GROUP BY GD.location, GD.severity;
SELECT P.affected_area, P.start_time, RT.team_name FROM PowerOutages P JOIN RestorationLog RL ON P.outage_id = RL.outage_id JOIN ResponseTeams RT ON RL.team_id = RT.team_id;
SELECT * FROM power_outages;
SELECT location, start_time, outage_type FROM power_outages WHERE outage_type = 'Planned';
SELECT * FROM grid_disturbances ORDER BY severity DESC;
SELECT description, timestamp FROM grid_disturbances WHERE location = 'City Center' ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT outage_id, technician_name, start_time, end_time FROM restoration_efforts WHERE start_time > '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM power_outages ORDER BY start_time DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT location, start_time, end_time FROM power_outages WHERE outage_type = 'Planned' ORDER BY start_time;
SELECT location, COUNT(outage_id) AS total_outages FROM power_outages GROUP BY location HAVING COUNT(outage_id) > 3;
SELECT * FROM grid_disturbances WHERE severity = 'High' AND location LIKE '%City%' ORDER BY timestamp DESC;

SELECT outage_reports.reporter_name, outage_reports.report_time, restoration_efforts.technician_name, restoration_efforts.start_time FROM outage_reports INNER JOIN restoration_efforts ON outage_reports.outage_id = restoration_efforts.outage_id ORDER BY outage_reports.report_time ASC, restoration_efforts.start_time ASC LIMIT 5;
